text:
Fwd: ‚ö° Register Now for Energy Week at Duke

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: *Nicholas Institute for Energy, Environment & Sustainability* <

>
Date: Wed, 19 Oct 2022 at 23:15
Subject: ‚ö° Register Now for Energy Week at Duke
To: Fedor Nepsha <

>
Duke University Energy Conference + much more!
*************************************
Register now for Energy Week at Duke!
*************************************
*How can an equitable and resilient energy system help us combat the climate crisis? And what will it take to get there?*
Register now for

(November 7 ‚Äì 10, 2022) to engage with these questions and others via networking events, panel discussions and keynote talks with industry experts, and more.
*Monday, Nov. 7*
* Kickoff event and reception focused on

(6 - 8 p.m. ET), featuring a keynote by *Alice C. Hill* (Council on Foreign Relations). Co-hosted by the Sanford School of Public Policy as part of the Rubenstein Distinguished Lecture Series. Come learn and network! The event will also be streamed on the Sanford School's

channel.
* Finalist presentations and networking lunch for the

text.text: Energy in Emerging Markets Case Competition

text:
(3:30 - 6:30 p.m. ET) featuring panels and coffee chats with energy leaders from organizations including Microsoft, AES, Environmental Defense Fund, Solstice Initiative, and more. Coffee chats open only to Duke students (information will be shared with all registrants).
* Dinner discussion on

(6:30 - 8:30 p.m. ET) Only a few tickets remaining for alumni, faculty, and community members.
*Wednesday, Nov. 9*
* The 14 th annual

(9 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. ET), focused on grid decarbonization (scroll down for agenda). Early-bird discount in effect until Wed., Oct. 26!
*Thursday, Nov. 10*
* The
(5 - 7:30 p.m. ET), a workshop where students from Duke and beyond can develop solutions for a vehicle electrification challenge. All graduate student tickets claimed; only undergrad tickets remain!

at the Fuqua School of Business, which will feature keynotes by *Danielle Merfield (GE Renewable Energy)* and *Audrey Zibelman (X, the moonshot factory)* in addition to panel discussions and alumni power pitches. Attendees can also enjoy a light breakfast, lunch, and networking reception.

text.text: Sign me up for the Conference.

text:
*************************
About Energy Week at Duke
*************************
This annual event series is organized by dozens of students from undergraduate and graduate degree programs across Duke University, with advising and support from the

text.text: Nicholas Institute for Energy, Environment & Sustainability
EDGE Center at the Fuqua School of Business

text:
generously help to underwrite Energy Week.
This effort reflects the

, which unites the university‚Äôs education, research, operations and public service missions to address the climate crisis. The commitment builds on Duke‚Äôs longstanding leadership in climate, energy and sustainability to educate a new generation of climate-fluent innovators and create equitable solutions for all.

text.text: Forward to a friend or colleague.
View this email in your browser

text: Copyright ¬© 2022 Nicholas Institute for Energy, Environment & Sustainability, All rights reserved.

Register now for Energy Week at Duke!
*************************************
*How can an equitable and resilient energy system help us combat the climate crisis? And what will it take to get there?*
Register now for

(November 7 ‚Äì 10, 2022) to engage with these questions and others via networking events, panel discussions and keynote talks with industry experts, and more.
*Monday, Nov. 7*
* Kickoff event and reception focused on

(6 - 8 p.m. ET), featuring a keynote by *Alice C. Hill* (Council on Foreign Relations). Co-hosted by the Sanford School of Public Policy as part of the Rubenstein Distinguished Lecture Series. Come learn and network! The event will also be streamed on the Sanford School's

channel.
* Finalist presentations and networking lunch for the
Energy in Emerging Markets Case Competition

(3:30 - 6:30 p.m. ET) featuring panels and coffee chats with energy leaders from organizations including Microsoft, AES, Environmental Defense Fund, Solstice Initiative, and more. Coffee chats open only to Duke students (information will be shared with all registrants).
* Dinner discussion on

(6:30 - 8:30 p.m. ET) Only a few tickets remaining for alumni, faculty, and community members.
*Wednesday, Nov. 9*
* The 14 th annual

(9 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. ET), focused on grid decarbonization (scroll down for agenda). Early-bird discount in effect until Wed., Oct. 26!
*Thursday, Nov. 10*
* The
(5 - 7:30 p.m. ET), a workshop where students from Duke and beyond can develop solutions for a vehicle electrification challenge. All graduate student tickets claimed; only undergrad tickets remain!

at the Fuqua School of Business, which will feature keynotes by *Danielle Merfield (GE Renewable Energy)* and *Audrey Zibelman (X, the moonshot factory)* in addition to panel discussions and alumni power pitches. Attendees can also enjoy a light breakfast, lunch, and networking reception.
Sign me up for the Conference.

*************************
About Energy Week at Duke
*************************
This annual event series is organized by dozens of students from undergraduate and graduate degree programs across Duke University, with advising and support from the
Nicholas Institute for Energy, Environment & Sustainability
EDGE Center at the Fuqua School of Business

generously help to underwrite Energy Week.
This effort reflects the

, which unites the university‚Äôs education, research, operations and public service missions to address the climate crisis. The commitment builds on Duke‚Äôs longstanding leadership in climate, energy and sustainability to educate a new generation of climate-fluent innovators and create equitable solutions for all.
